result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brianna Lee Bearheart

records.addlTxt: 9:57 AM Cases 15CF164, 17CM374, 17CM405, 18CF142, 19CF71, 20CF157 called together.  Defendant Brianna Lee Bearheart not in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney James H Krave in court for Brianna Lee Bearheart.  Attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for State of Wisconsin. Def fails to appear for status conferences and a prelim in 20CF157. Court notes def requested Zoom information twice- yesterday and today and was told she must appear in person.  Witness appears by Zoom to testify.  State requests warrant and forfeiture of cash bond posted.  Atty Krave stands mute.  Court orders warrant, body only, orders cash bond posted forfeited (if def returns within 30 days with proof that she has covid today- court may set aside forfeiture).
Status conference on June 1, 2022 at 09:45 am.

01:04 PM Cases 17CM405, 15CF164, 18CF142, 17CM374, 19CF71, and 20CF157 called together.  Defendant Brianna Lee Bearheart in court with attorney James H Krave.  Defendant in custody appearing from Burnett County Jail.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Brianna Lee Bearheart appeared by video means with Attorney.  Case 20CF157 on for initial appearance, all others on for status conferences.  Atty Krave updates- global offer has been extended, reviewed, but not the charges in 20CF157 (limited time available to do so w/recent appointment.)  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  Discussion of bond.  Krave makes record.  Bond continues.  Status conference scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Status conference on May 18, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report

$5,000 cash bond must be posted to cover Burnett County cases 15CF164, 17CM374, 17CM405, 18CF142, 19CF71, and 20CF157.  No contact with MD.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  No contact with SN.  No use or possession of illegal drugs, substances, or paraphernalia without a valid prescription.  Subject to random testing of blood breath or urine upon reasonable suspicion or arrest by any law enforcement or corrections officer.
Motion hearing on May 11, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

02:51 PM Cases 15CF164, 17CM374, 17CM405, 18CF142, 19CF71, and 20CF157 called together.  Defendant Brianna Lee Bearheart in court, in custody.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Brianna Lee Bearheart appeared by video means.  PD's office has not found an attorney for the def as of yet.  Case set for a bail/bond hearing.  Court makes record, has reviewed def's pro-se bond motion.  Def argues in support of setting a bond that would facilitate her release from custody.  DA argues against bond modification.  Court addresses the defendant, reviews previous bond.  Court sets bond at $5k cash, same conditions as previous bond.  JA to reach out to prior attorneys and try to get PD's office to appoint one of them.  Motion hearing scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report
Bail/bond hearing on May 4, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Def letter to the court

records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Order to withdraw
Notice of Motion and Motion to Withdraw
Returned Notice of Bail/Bond Forfeiture to bond poster.
Only the judge may quash this warrant.

11:20 AM Cases 15CF164, 17CM374, 17CM405, 18CF142, 19CF71, 20CF157 called together for status conferences.  Attorney Ralph David Imholte in court.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means for defendant.  Defendant fails to appear by any means.  Court reviews history of FTA.  State requests forfeiture of any cash posted and warrant for WI and adjacents states.  Atty Imholte stands mute.  Court orders body-only warrant that only she may quash, and orders the cash bond posted forfeited.  Any cash forfeited will first be applied to balance owed with county, then general county fund.
Status conference on July 15, 2021 at 11:15 am.

11:38 AM Cases 15CF164, 17CM374, 17CM405, 18CF142, 19CF71, and 20CF157 called together for status conferences.  Defendant, Brianna Lee Bearheart, appeared.  Atty. Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared on behalf of State of Wisconsin.  All in person.  Cases on for status conferences.  Defendant only applied for PD two days ago, appears without an attorney.  Court will set sentencing hearing in 15CF164 and reset the other cases.  State requests STC for a week out for def to get PD.
Status conference on July 15, 2021 at 11:15 am.
OSPD First Appointment of Counsel Report
Status conference on June 24, 2021 at 11:15 am.

02:08 PM Cases 15CF164, 17CM374, 17CM405, 18CF142, 19CF71, 20CF157 called together.  Defendant, Brianna Lee Bearheart, appeared.  Atty. James Jay Rennicke appeared on behalf of State of Wisconsin.  Def appears, missed appearance earlier in the day- citing car trouble.  Court quashes warrant previously ordered.  Def must apply for a PD (court orders).  Court does not forfeit the bond, finds good cause to set aside the forfeiture.  Def states she posted $2k in Douglas County.  Status conference scheduled for June 24, 2021 at 11:15 am.

12:03 PM Cases 15CF164, 17CM374, 17CM405, 18CF142, 19CF71, and 20CF157 called together.  Defendant Brianna Lee Bearheart not in court.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Def fails to appear, was scheduled for 11:30 AM.  Def contacted JA and stated she'd be late, has made no further contact.  Defendant has not obtained an attorney as instructed.  State requests forfeiture of any cash bond posted and for a nationwide warrant.  Court orders warrant, only judge may quash, notes multiple failures to appear, $5,000 cash bond on the warrant.  All cash that has been posted (believes $2500 posted) will be forfeited due to def's FTA.
Status conference on June 3, 2021 at 11:30 am.

09:40 AM Cases 15CF164, 17CM374, 17CM405, 18CF142, 19CF71, and 20CF157 called together.  Defendant, Brianna Lee Bearheart, appeared.  Atty. James Jay Rennicke appeared on behalf of State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised by the court, off the record, that she is required to appear in person to every court date and that she'll need to re-apply for a PD for all these cases.  Cases all on for status conferences.  Bond continues.  Status conference scheduled for June 3, 2021 at 11:30 am.
Status conference on May 21, 2021 at 09:15 am.
Status conference on May 21, 2021 at 09:15 am.

records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel
Motion and prop. order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: 02:30 PM 15CF164, 17CM374, 17CM405, 18CF142, 19CF71, 20CF157 called together.  Attorney James H Krave in court.  Daniel Patrick Steffen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant fails to appear.  All parties appear by phone/video means due to COVID19 mandates.  Off the record 2:31 PM.  Back on the record 2:32 PM, same appearances as previously noted.  Defendant has failed to appear by any means despite valid notice.  State requests warrant, forfeiture of $1500 cash posted previously, cash bond on warrant.  Court issues warrant, $2000 cash bail must be posted for release, court orders cash bond previously posted $1500 to be directed to past due fines and fees.
Status conference on July 9, 2020 at 02:15 pm.

09:42 AM 20CF17, 15CF164, 17CM374, 18CF142, 19CF71, 20CF17 called together.  Defendant, Brianna Lee Bearheart, appeared with Attorney James H Krave.  Attorney James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State.  Brianna Lee Bearheart appeared by video means with Attorney.    All parties appear by Zoom video means due to COVID19 mandates.  Case 20CF17 was on for preliminary hearing, but no witness appear on behalf of the State.  Atty Krave, believes these matters will still resolve, eventually, moves to dismiss the matter.  State asks for dismissal without prejudice for refiling.  Case 20CF17 is dismissed without prejudice, may be refiled.  Parties encouraged to continue working toward a global resolution.  If this is to resolve in a plea, will need to be an in-person hearing, and parties need to notify Court 2 weeks from any plea date if this is a global resolution.  State asks for a status conference.  Bond continues.  Status conference scheduled for July 9, 2020 at 02:15 pm.
Instructions on how to appear remotely

01:06 PM Cases 20CF17, 19CF71, 18CF142, 17CM405, 17CM374 and 15CF164 called together.  Defendant Brianna Lee Bearheart in court with attorney James H Krave appearing telephonically.  Defendant in custody.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Cases on for status conferences and a return on warrant/initial appearance in 20CF17.  Judgment was entered on 15CF164 and def is awaiting sentencing in that matter.  In 20CF17, case on for an Initial Appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  Bond needs to be reset- cash previously posted has been forfeited.  On bond, State requests cash bond of $1500, same conditions as previous bond.  Atty Krave argues for $500 cash bond.  Discussion of cash bond forfeiture- Court notes she has reviewed letter from def, orders $1500 additional cash, same conditions.  WTLPH.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 30, 2020 at 03:30 pm.

03:01 PM 20CF17 and 15CF164 called together.  Defendant Brianna Lee Bearheart not in court.  Daniel Patrick Steffen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matters set for initial appearance and motion for entry of judgment.  Court reviews DJOC in 15CF164, takes judicial notice of open Washburn and Burnett County cases charging further criminal allegations.  DA asks that judgment be entered in 15CF164.  Court orders warrant, body only for 15CF164.
Status conference on February 12, 2020 at 01:00 pm.
$662.56 for restitution was paid to DA's office

records.addlTxt: Defendant Brianna Lee Bearheart in court, in custody.  William Lund Norine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Def. waives attorney for hearing.  Discussion regarding payment of restitution.  Court will deny DA's motion @ this time.  Def. is to pay $662.56 by Sept. 29th.
Motion hearing on September 22, 2017 at 11:45 am.

Defendant Brianna Lee Bearheart in court, in custody.  William Lund Norine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. The State appears by DA Norine. State addresses the Court, Def. has not made any arrangement to make payments toward restitution. The Court examines Def. She will be getting a lump sum payment, the State will withdraw the motion if restitution is paid. New date given.
